Package io.github.sanyarnd.applocker

Class AppLocker

java.lang.Object
io.github.sanyarnd.applocker.AppLocker
All Implemented Interfaces:
AutoCloseable
public final class AppLocker extends Object implements AutoCloseable
The Locker class provides methods for a locking mechanism and encapsulates socket-based message server for IPC.

No need to call unlock() directly, method will be called once JVM is terminated. Feel free to call unlock() any time if it is required by your application logic.

Author:
Alexander Biryukov

    • lock

      public void lock() throws InterruptedException
      Acquire the lock.
      Throws:
      LockingBusyException - if lock has already been taken by someone
      LockingException - if any error has occurred during the locking process (I/O exception)
      InterruptedException

    • unlock

      public void unlock() throws InterruptedException
      Unlock the lock.
      Does nothing if a lock is not locked.
      Throws:
      InterruptedException

    • isLocked

      public boolean isLocked()
      Check if locker is busy.
      Returns:
      true if locked, false otherwise

    • sendMessage

      @NotNull public <I extends Serializable, O extends Serializable> O sendMessage(@NotNull I message)
      Send a message to AppLocker instance that's holding the lock (including self).
      Type Parameters:
      I - message type
      O - return type
      Parameters:
      message - message
      Returns:
      the answer from AppLocker's message messageHandler
      Throws:
      LockingException - if there's a trouble communicating to other AppLocker instance
